body: We have been visiting Scitech ever since we moved to Western Australia. Our son was then 17 and he enjoyed it. He's now 29 and still likes to go, but now we also take his young cousins, aged 10 and 12. We first took the twelve year old when he was four and the magic has stayed. Especially recommend the Imax cinema and the space movie. I could sit through it time and again.
title: Fun for every generation!

body: Great place for the whole family, you will definately find out things you never knew before. The planetarium show is realistic and entertaining. There is something for all ages, from puppet shows to baby chicks to science displays for the older kids.
title: Great place for the whole family, you...

body: Future Scientist beware, you are missing out if your parents don't take you for a day out at SciTech. Lose your kids there, as they immerse themselves in exploring gravity, technology and a whole heap of other occupying scientific experiments and ideas aimed to create interest and satisfy curiosity.
title: Every Kid should visit - Mums and Dads will enjoy too!

body: I often take my son here as it's such fun for kids (and grown up's)
title: Great fun

body: It is all that complicated science explained so simply through hands on experience. Displays are always changing so you can go again & again. Given every city seems to have a ""SciTech", I'd recommend visitors to Perth to visit the unique sights of Perth rather than this attraction.
title: Learn by Experience

body: Will never fail all ages as the exibits change....Food is an issue, either downstairs in the centre cafe or within the venue itself its limited. Best to do a morning and go elsewhere for lunch like stickey beakys at Kings Park.
title: Variation Rules...

body: The Scitech people do a great job of making the most out of a relatively small space (with a planetarium, labs, hands-on experiments, displays...) but Perth is getting big enough now to need more. This place is very popular and centrally located, but it lacks any connection with the "environment". Other places do it better...
title: Wish it was bigger.

body: Kids will absolutey adore this place, i did when i was a kid. Its full of things that are interactive and a great way to learn a lot of things. Science is a fascinating subject and this is a great place to epose your children to the wonders of the world. i recommend the galaxy show where you look up at the stars. Parking undernieith or catch the train. A great day out.

body: The dinosaurs exhibit is fantastic - there are several really life like models including a dinosaur incubating a clutch of hatching eggs. Some really good interactive displays. The planetarium show was good as ever we saw the weather in the solar system haivng seen the other two shows before (they could do with some new ones). there was a show on we would have gone for had it been noted on the website, which doesnt seem to be updated with all that is happening. Sadly the helicopter flight sim was broken, but kids were happy enough just sitting in the copter.
title: Dinosaurs are ace

body: Scietch is a great place for the family or friends. The different shows and unsual things to discover and play are amazing. I love the section when you go through this tunnel and it will count down and it will print your shadow on the screen. The themes are always changing so it's never the same which i think is great because then you can visit it as much as you want.

Extremely good value for money, a must for your kids

body: We visited Scitech in March this year and had a really enjoyable day out. Our children are 2 and 4 and there was plenty to entertain them both. My 2 year old son loved building a wall, using the wheelbarrows and posting bricks. My daughter saw one of the shows and was really keen to try each of the exhibits. We all loved the lifeboat ball pool and lost my son a few times. The 360 degree bike was a hit with my husband although he came off it feeling a little sick!! We spent a full day there and would thoroughly recommend it as a great day out.
title: Fun day out for kids and mum and dad

body: This was the second birthday party we'd been to at Scitech with my 6 year old. There are so many things to see and do, it's always a great half day out for us. Party wise the staff seemed to be struggling and had help from parents in attendance to get the party food out, but they were great with the kids so that made up for it!

body: This was the second birthday party we'd been to at Scitech with my 6 year old. There are so many things to see and do, it's always a great half day out for us. Party wise the staff seemed to be struggling and had help from parents in attendance to get the party food out, but they were great with the kids so that made up for it!
title: Birthday party

body: We visited Scitech in March this year and had a really enjoyable day out. Our children are 2 and 4 and there was plenty to entertain them both. My 2 year old son loved building a wall, using the wheelbarrows and posting bricks. My daughter saw one of the shows and was really keen to try each of the exhibits. We all loved the lifeboat ball pool and lost my son a few times. The 360 degree bike was a hit with my husband although he came off it feeling a little sick!! We spent a full day there and would thoroughly recommend it as a great day out.
title: Fun day out for kids and mum and dad

body: Great place to educate children and grand children in a stimulating and fun manner. ticks all the right boxes for a family afternoon.
title: kid friendly

body: Had a fantastic time with our son. Even we learned a thing or two. Great value but you should allow a few hours to truly get your money's worth.
title: great family fun

body: Fantastic for kids who have a facination with how things work. Great day out.

body: So many things to do, so much to learn, and try out. We went as 3 mums and 5 children under 5. Was great to see the kids so involved with all the things to see and do.
title: Family outing

body: Scitech always fascinates the kids, they have many displays, everything is interactive, there is an area for the little kids that is a bit like 'Bob theBuilder' and lots for them to do in there. There is a shop and the planetarium (for children over 4 as it gets VERY dark in there) which is worth a visit as it really is a awesome experience.
title: Science fun for kids (and adults)

body: Brilliant place for children to learn in a interactive environment. The program changes which is fantastic and children are happy to visit over and over. For parents there is easy parking below the building and light food can be provided. The cost is a little high for struggling families which is not fare. Scitech should be for everyone to learn. Science and Maths are the weakest subjects in the classroom and anything that can help students become engaged and wanting to learn more about science - well and good. Should be sponsered completely by the government and free for all children under 15 years to visit.
title: Great place for Kids

body: I was visiting Perth with my young family and a local friend recommended Scitech. I hadnt heard of it before so wasnt sure what to expect. Our 3 and 5 year old had a fantastic time exploring all the interactive displays in the huge open area inside. We only had a couple of hours to spare so did not get a chance to look at all of the exhibits but when we are next in Perth we will certainly be back!
title: Great place for kids of all ages!

body: I took a group of girls to scitech ages 8-10. They had a great time. We spent the whole day there. We watched a couple of shows. I found the staff fantastic. There was many walking around willing to help and show the kids how things work. That was great and very much appreciated it. Good day out!
title: Entertaining!

body: Took my 3 and a half year old, he loved it and would not leave, we ended up staying like 4 hours. Friendly staff!! I had fun too.
title: fun day out

body: If you have kids and half a day to waste, this is a great place. Go to website and check for show times though to coordinate a visit.
title: Lots to do

body: Love scitech. Went with my son who now 6 but we've been visiting here since he was about 3. Loads to do and great fun for the whole family.
title: Educational

body: If you're local, buy a membership so you can take your kids regularly. Along with plenty of static displays (I never get sick of checking out the little chicks hatching) they regularly change the exhibits. Last time I was there, I took my 6 y.o. grandson on a weekday (it was a pupil free day at his school). We got there at around 9am and pretty much spent the rest of the day there - and I had to talk him in to leaving at around 3.30! I've been taking him there for some years now and will continue to do so as long as he wants to. They have puppet shows, the planetarium and science 'shows' throughout the day too.
title: A great day out for the kids.

title: fun day out

body: If you have kids and half a day to waste, this is a great place. Go to website and check for show times though to coordinate a visit.
title: Lots to do

body: SciTech is the only place of its kind in Perth, which is the reason we take the kids there about once a year. But it is small and very crowded on busy days. If you can get a season pass (very reasonable cost) and take advantage of the special activities which you can book into, it is well worth it. Try very hard to go in off peak times if you want a pleasant experience, or else your kids will have a hard time getting on any popular exhibits, and many people let their badly behaved kids run around with no supervision while they sit in the table area and relax. No caf inside is a huge downfall, just vending machines.
title: Too small and very crowded.

title: fun day out

body: This is a great location to take your curious kids to learn about science. There are lots of interactive experiences to be had. There's an area for eating and I noticed a number of parents had brought their lunches with them. Many mothers with babies appeared to be very comfortable. While you eat you can observe some scientists (behind the glass) going about their duties in a lab. My children were very excited. The only downer was the presentation about the brain. The young man presenting wasn't coping too well with his young audience and some of the activities were too advanced for these kids. Overall, we were glad we visited:)
title: Busy kid heaven

body: Although I am 14 I decided to take my aunty out to show her the place I adored as a child! We got off the train and walked over the road. There are always terrific exhibits there and it is always changing! Even for me it was fun and interesting! I highly recommend a visit here! This is a place your kids will never forget!
title: A Great Day For The Kids!

body: Great family entertainment , lots of hands on and changes around regularly so keeps kids keen to go again, fun for parents to try different things too not limited to kiddos

body: Scitech is a great place for kids to learn about science and how things work. This is a very hands on place where both the kids and parents can enjoy themselves and even the parents could learn a new thing or two. With a cafe on site and free parking though limited time (unless you ask for a parking voucher to display on your dashboard), this is well worth a visit .

body: This place is great for keeping up to date and always having something new on, so no matter how many times you take your kids, there will always be new things to try, learn, watch and play with. Value for money. They do a great job!
title: Great for inquisitive kids/teens

body: The ever changing exhibits makes this a venue to visit at least a few times per year. Kids of all ages will be entertained and bemused by the wonders of science.
title: Great learning

body: This is a great place to enjoy with kids or without.
title: Great for all to enjoy

body: We took the grandchildren here and they just loved it...it doent seem to matter what age yu are there is something for everyone...I learn some stuff that Im sure I new at one time but had forgotten. and of course the grandies can teach us a thing or two.
title: Be a Kid again.

body: I took my nephew to Scitech for the first time, altho i had been befour, He enjoyed it so much I had trouble getting him to leave.
title: Fantastic !

body: SciTech is a great place for kids. Lots of noise, hands on activities and a lots of wonderful experiences.
title: Sharing My City

body: We took the grand kids here. The best way is by train or if you drive you will get a parking voucher at the entrance. Parking is underneath.
title: Kids will love it!

body: I like taking my kids here- they change their exhibits and displays regularly so there's always something to do and learn. Sometimes there are school visits so it gets very busy and noisy, school holidays are also busy but it's a good day out and kids find it exciting.
title: Great for kids, very educational

body: So much do do and see at scitech that is both educational and fun for young and old. There are hands on activities to be done as well as very informative sessions that explain science topics and experiments. Also included in the entrance fee is the IMAX theatre that has different shows through out the day. You can spend all day there if you wanted to.
title: Fun day out for all

body: I've been here a few times but the best is Adults Only Night/ After Dark. It's run twice a year, same price, same exhibition plus more. They set up a bar for drinks and have added stations where staff get you to try different experience and explain the science! They even had a Segway.
title: Adults only night is amaing!

body: What a great way to spend 3.5 hours on a very wet winter day! My 3 kids and their 3 friends had an absolute ball in SciTech, our one regret was we didn't enter the spy exhibit earlier - they kicked us out a closing time and we still didn't have the answers! The kids aged 10 - 6 had an absolute ball
title: Spy exhibition was the best!

body: Most of the hands on things there were so over used and/or broken it wasn't funny. The astronomy dome was enjoyable and informative.
title: Needs a major update.

body: I took my grandson recently (it was our second visit!) and we both had a ball. The exhibits both stand alone and interactive are wonderful, entertaining and stimulating. Thoroughly recommended.
title: A grand child's heaven!

body: There was more than enough here to keep us entertained for three hours on a wet day in Perth. We only came across two exhibits that were broken. I almost had to run to keep up with my 7 year old as he zoomed from exhibit to exhibit. We also attended a hour long educational musical (included in the ticket price) which was a good chance to rest some tired legs. Their website doesn't list a restaurant, but there is actually one next to where you purchase tickets.
title: My 7 year old didn't want to leave

body: This is the best attraction in the whole of Australia, and not just for kids, adults can also enjoy it! As well as being fun it is also educational, which is good. One of the best things there is a show they put on a few times a day where you would go in a sort of cinema but the screen was 360 degrees around you, it taught you about the solar system.
title: Amazing

body: As we were there during a week day when most kids were in school we had it to ourselves which was great. The downside to this is it looked a little shabby - but definitely worth the $30 for the two of us for 3 hours. Would definitely go again.
title: Great fun - but getting a little shabby

body: This is such a great day out. I first went there with my 6 yr old son 10 years ago and he LOVED it.....we went back this year and.....he LOVED it (me too, just saying).
title: GREAT day out!

body: Scitech - the name may put many off because it sounds like it will be very boring and all about science, don't let that stop you!!!! I am not a science fan myself but there are so much cool and exciting exhibitions to visit and great place for kids!
title: One of the best places in perth!

body: This place is outstanding. It is so educational and entertaining for kids and adults. We thoroughly enjoyed it !

body: There is so much for kids to do and see here. Even chicks hatching out of eggs on display. There's lots of inter active activity and kids can just run around and go nuts. We'll definitely go back
title: Absolutely fabulous for kids

body: We were exhausted at trying to find the place but once there we had a great time working our way around the code cracking exhibit. It really pulled us all in and we felt a sense of achievement at completing the course. Other exhibits were a little tired looking but we had fun with the bowling and cricket balls and the hang glider. Fun for kids, tweens and parents.
title: Brilliant Code Breaking

body: This is a great place for kids and parents if you like to get up close and personal with Science in motion. Our little girl is just two years and 10 months and she was easily engrossed with the several activities and gadgets set up for her age group. she adorned her construction helmet, picked up her wheel barrow, sponge bricks and was as busy as Bob the builder in a matter of minutes. It didn't matter that she had no clue that she was using a pulley system and experimenting with Newtons theory of gravity she found her own little game and system to hoist the bricks to build the wall and what fun she had doing this.
title: Little Einstein' Paradise

body: What an excellent centre!!! We thought at first that it was a small place since it was located within a shopping mall. The staff were also friendly and helpful.

body: I took my nearly 6 year old daughter to Scitech on the last day of her school holidays, most schools had already gone back so it was a reasonably quiet day there.
title: Staff the highlight

body: I went with a friend during the Easter holiday week, when it was packed with children/parents. I went to see 'We are all aliens' in the planetarium, which was very good, what I saw of it, but unfortunately I fell asleep during it - no reflection on the show itself, I just didn't get enough sleep the night before and the seat was far too comfy! I also went to 'Ignite your curiosity', a chemistry show in the science theatre - you will definitely not fall asleep during this! I walked around the 'Ingenious!' exhibitions, of which there were lots, but did not get to try any out as children were on all of them. I would go again, but only when children are in school. It was expensive enough at AUD17. I had a look through the discovery shop and it had lots of things. I didn't get any as I had to get a flight and did not want to carry more, but if you've space there is plenty of choice.
title: wish I'd gone outside of school holidays

body: Scitech is best visited with children, because then it is easy to try all the experiments and exhibits without feeling you are in the way of children bursting to have a go! The exhibitions and displays change regularly, so there is always something new to try and also to learn. The kids love the place and rush from experiment to experiment! Be prepared to be exhausted and, perhaps, to show your ignorance if you aren't a science buff!
title: Be ready to be surprised!

body: well located, plenty of science and education products for the kids to get hands on, that is the best part, the planetarium theatre is 3-D and fantastic, a great experience.
title: space adventure

body: 2-3x a year they host an Adults only night - back in october the theme was based around being a Spy and solving a mystery. The fun is that its very hands on as you can try out different spy techniques. the rest of the sci tech building is open too. plus they serve alcoholic beverages, so its a lot of fun to spend a saturday evening with your mates and their mates :-) Do line up early for the planetarium show. again you can bring your drink inside. the presentor is very humorous and knowledgeble and with a bit of banter back and to the audience, it is a good laugh while chilling in the reclining chairs watching the universe projected above you.
title: Great way to spend a saturday with friends - Adults only night

body: Scitech in Perth has a dazzling range of working scientific displays that visitors can try and see how and why they work. The hands-on approach, right down to a bed of nails, means even the most "I'm bored" child (or adult) will have great difficulty finding an excuse to be so.
title: Why is it so?

body: Scitech in Perth has a dazzling range of working scientific displays that visitors can try and see how and why they work. The hands-on approach, right down to a bed of nails, means even the most "I'm bored" child (or adult) will have great difficulty finding an excuse to be so.
title: Why is it so?

body: Very dated looking. This place looks very tired. Needs an update especially as they charge so much for entry.
title: Baz

body: Hands-on science and technology experience for everyone. Very friendly and informative staff. Close to public transport (train). Great outing for a rainy day and encourages kids to think 'outside' the square (even if they aren't aware of it!).
title: Fantastic outing for kids of all ages

body: I think scitech is great the first time you visit. If you go quite soon afterwards then it is a bit samish but if you wait til they change some of their displays then it's a nice surprise for next time you visit. It's in a small shopping centre, you park underneath and they give you a free pass for exciting. They have a cafe and shop. In my personal opinion it's quite expensive for what it is.
title: great the first time

body: This is great fun for the family and the kids will be thrilled with all the hands on activities for them to use, a fun day out for the whole family.
title: Scitech

body: well located, plenty of science and education products for the kids to get hands on, that is the best part, the planetarium theatre is 3-D and fantastic, a great experience.
title: space adventure

body: I'm in love with this place. I took my kids (2 and 4) today because it was raining. We only found one item not working properly, the rest worked great. Get there early for the science lab show and puppet show. I wasn't able to do the planetarium show because you need to be 4yrs old and older to get in. The staff was informative and so friendly. They even taught us how to do a few carnival tricks. I found myself telling the kids to hold on a minute while mommy finishes this...because it was even fun for me. They had something for all ages. The only negative I can think of is the hours need to be longer in the day. We spent 5 hrs there and even though we got to see/do everything, we wanted more time. I will stop here every time we are in perth! This is a must for families with any age kids, heck I would go with just my spouse.
title: Best science I have been to...and that is a lot.

body: I was bringing a 10 yr old child to this place and I wasn't expecting much when I visited this place. However the movie was mind blowing, 360degree theatre showing history of planes and the galaxy was just amazing. The game centre was so much fun too, there are a lot of games which involves physics. It is a great place to visit.
title: Not just for kids

body: A wide variety of interesting exhibits and free wifi. We visited Scitech on 3 separate occasions as we have a pass and my son loved it. Being so close to Kings Park, we could easily move between the two places depending on the weather. Astro cafe served surprisingly good food. We ate there twice.
title: Enough fun for 8yo to ask to return 3 times.

body: With family not young or teens; An educational visit including the extreme weather teaching session. We saw a contained cloud being made in a tube. Got inside a cyclone event and survived some thundery wet weather, joined in making a volcano, Did some paragliding, crashed a couple of times, laid on a bed of nails (ouch), did some spirograph art, played with electric motors, found out all about carnival tricks and delighted in the mirror maze. Felt what it is like to be guillotined was left with my head on a platter. Visited the discovery centre and will need to go back for more including the planetarium. Brilliant!
title: Carnival theme and more much more

body: This is a brilliant place to take the grandkids, mine love it there is so much to learn and enjoy, we go home exhausted, it's good value for money. Even us big kids get something from it
title: Grandkids love it

body: Our kids loved Scitech and the Planetarium. The live show in the Planetarium was very well presented.
title: Planetarium is Great!

body: I came here with my partner. We don't have kids but thought we'd check it out. It's just child orientated and not a lot of fun for adults. I thought it may be educational but it was more of a play ground. Good to do to pass away an hour but don't go out of your way.
title: Not for adults with no kids

body: This was the perfect place to spend a rainy day with the kids recently. Everything there is designed to appeal and educate anyone of any age. Parents are just as enthralled as the kids. Our kids insisted on doing the circuit twice - just in case they missed something. We loved the finds in the shop afterwards too.
title: Brilliant!

body: We decided to join here as we will be able to visit some other science centers in the US as well. The kids especially liked the bed of nails in the circus attraction as well as the great planetarium shows. Would definitely recommend avoiding the weekends and school holidays as well and it is so much easier to enjoy on the other days.
title: Great for kids on a Rainy Day

body: Took the Grand daughter (4) for her first visit. She was fascinated by the displays. She enjoyed trying the different experiments even if she didn't understand them. It was all a wonderful experience for her. She absolutely loved it. Can't wait to take her back when she is a bit older. I enjoyed it just as much.
title: Fascinating

body: Scitech is a fun place for kids 3-10 to play and learn in a safe environment. Kids that live in Perth, like myself, have usually gone there at least ten times by the age of thirteen, so it gets a bit boring, but for kids who have never been or are from another city it would be fun. There is a section for smaller kids and section for big kids, as well as a cafe for parents.
title: Fun place for young kids

body: SciTech is a very educational and a wonderful place to take children that teaches them about science and how interesting things really are. Get a group together...definitely worth a visit.
title: *** Scitech ***

body: Scitech has a lot of hands on activities for a variety of ages. There are several different themed areas. I especially liked the movies shown in the theatre. The number of people was not overwhelming and when we had to wait in line for an activity, it want more than a few minutes. There were a few areas that didn't seem to get refreshed like the Lego and car building areas.

body: We took our grandchilde age 5 to scitech. What a ball she had. She had her hands, feet, face ,voice, in everything. Her favourite was the sand pit that allows you to make mountains with beautiful feeling sand. She ran amok, not knowing which direction to go in first. I must admit, we had just as much fun showing her how things worked and watching her eyes light up. There is something there for all ages, even the grandies

body: I went with my husband, who wouldn't consider this a place to go, but I wanted to go. You don't have to be a child to enjoy it and both of us had a great time, also educational.
title: Great place even if you don't have kids

body: I spent an evening with my 3 grandkids (2years, Twins 6 years) and we all found the experience worthwhile. There is always something to capture a child (& adults!) attention and imagination. Citech is ideally located in central Perth, with train and freeway close by. There is plenty of parking available with the centre having food outlets.
title: Intering & Informative for young and old!

body: You'll easily spend a few hours here with kids aged around 3 to 12 enjoying it most. It's noisy but there's many hands on science experiments, which the kids and grown ups will love. This is where husbands and wifes start having fun too. The show is worthwhile attending and the giant omnimax screen is a definite!
title: A fun & educational experience for the family

body: I have taken my grandson to Scitech many times and we have spent hours there. He always enjoys the experiments and shows. Its a bit noisy but the kids have a great time and adults can enjoy the day as well. The show and the omnimax screen is definatly worthwhile attending. Also it educational for the children. We usually go by train which stops just across the road and a treat for my grandson.
title: Great for kids

body: Nothing to dislike about this place. Hands on everything. I was so excited I just kept thinking "my grandkids would LOVE this place." If you have kids, please take them. If they're interested in how things work, they'll love it. Plenty to entertain for easy hour. Husband and I had fun. The planetarium was included in entrance which was very reasonably priced. Nice little cafe downstairs also.
title: Got to go here

body: Probably not as enjoyable due to all the kids being out of school and it was a hot day. There was to many people to enjoy the Experiments. Only spent about 2 hours here
title: Small and crowded

body: I have been bringing Little Miss 7 here since she was 2 and she absolutely loves it. She asks to go 2-3 times a year and never gets tired of the regular attractions. The Scitech guys are great and the theatre shows are just the right length for the youngsters. I love the huge ball pulley/crank machines - lactic acid after 2 mins! Be careful with parking as the inspectors underneath are really vigilant!
title: Young Einsteins

body: WAs wondering what else to do in Perth for our forever feeling bored children when we decide to try Scitech. Not a place any tourist would consider visiting for a holiday but decided to go anyway so that our children would have something for them. The place has enough scientific activities for anyone to spend the day or the afternoon . No rush, take some time to play with exploratory toys and almost every activity was in good working order . My kids had fun and that's all it matters to us as parents.
title: Educational and Fun for children

body: Bad pun, but what a fantastic night we had, the girls were dressed up in their favourite Halloween outfits and the staff were brilliant. The planetarium was again, amazing. Lots to touch and play with. and there is always something new to play with.

Be careful with parking as the inspectors underneath are really vigilant!
title: Young Einsteins

body: WAs wondering what else to do in Perth for our forever feeling bored children when we decide to try Scitech. Not a place any tourist would consider visiting for a holiday but decided to go anyway so that our children would have something for them. The place has enough scientific activities for anyone to spend the day or the afternoon . No rush, take some time to play with exploratory toys and almost every activity was in good working order . My kids had fun and that's all it matters to us as parents.
title: Educational and Fun for children

body: Bad pun, but what a fantastic night we had, the girls were dressed up in their favourite Halloween outfits and the staff were brilliant. The planetarium was again, amazing. Lots to touch and play with. and there is always something new to play with.
title: Halloween at Scitech was a spectre-cle!

body: I payed a visit on January, it was quite busy with families with children. So I recommend to visit when there are no school holidays. Please arrive early so that you don't miss the different shows they have during the day.
title: Amazing experience... for adults too!

body: Scitech was great, such a good way to get the next generations interested in science. Even the adults enjoyed trying to figure out a few of the experiments. Staff were all very helpful and happy. Worth a visit for both young and old.
title: Very cool

body: Probably not as enjoyable due to all the kids being out of school and it was a hot day. There was to many people to enjoy the Experiments. Only spent about 2 hours here
title: Small and crowded

body: Scitech was very interesting and fun for all. In the past you had to pay for Scitech and also for the Omni theatre show so we were stoked to see that the Omni theatre was a part of the entry to Scitech now so that was a bonus! Lots of kids running around everywhere but there was never a long wait to have a go at some imaginative or interesting hands on feature. And if there was...we just went around and came back to it. Lots of little quick and easy tests and interactive things to do...highly recommend it!
title: Fun to be had!

body: They have various shows at different points of time. The shows are good. The place itself is huge and has ample car park. Nice place to visit as family. Kids love it.
title: Good Experience

body: Great activity centre for the young ones to learn more about science. Fun exhibitions and shows for toddlers too. Farm animal petting such as chicken, baby cow, baby sheep, baby llama and baby rabbit. Adult entry $17, Kids $11. Toddlers enter free. I think it's a bit steep though.
title: Science & Activity Centre

body: My young kids and I have been to SciTech twice. Definitely somewhere to go when it is not the school holidays, you can barely move and can easily lose sight of your kids. However, in quieter times it is absolutely fantastic. They kids have so much fun and they don't even realise that they are learning. A highlight is the Planetarium. Nearly renovated and very educational.
title: A place to avoid during the school holidays.

title: Fun to be had!

body: If it's stinking hot outside, or pouring with rain, this is the place to hole up for a few hours. Scitech manages to entertain the youngest children, at the same time as offering fascinating new discoveries for the mature visitor. Whether you just enjoy browsing and pushing buttons, or participate more fully in the activities and presentations, there's something for everyone. Convenient for the centre of town, on the train line to Fremantle, and plenty of parking. Not cheap, but then what is in Perth?
title: The Excitement of Science

body: We were invited to attend the prize giving ceremony for my son. Glad to say we got to revisit this place and didn't knew it was so fun as our first visit was too rushed.

body: My young kids and I have been to SciTech twice. Definitely somewhere to go when it is not the school holidays, you can barely move and can easily lose sight of your kids. However, in quieter times it is absolutely fantastic. They kids have so much fun and they don't even realise that they are learning. A highlight is the Planetarium. Nearly renovated and very educational.
title: A place to avoid during the school holidays.

body: Great activity centre for the young ones to learn more about science. Fun exhibitions and shows for toddlers too. Farm animal petting such as chicken, baby cow, baby sheep, baby llama and baby rabbit. Adult entry $17, Kids $11. Toddlers enter free. I think it's a bit steep though.
title: Science & Activity Centre

body: Scitech is a great interactive place for kids of all ages from 3 to 93. There are permanent exhibits that demonstrate many scientific principles, themed featured exhibits that change every six months or so, live demonstrations, interactive shows for younger kids, a planetarium and a dedicated area for very young children. I have been to Scitech many times over the years, first with my own kids and now with my grandkids. The last time I went in Januray, I took my 5 year old grandson for his first ever visit. He was beside himself with delight. We happily spent 5 hours there and even then I almost had to drag him away. He now says he wants to be a scientist and work at Scitech.
title: Kid's Heaven

body: Good displays but aimed mainly at kids. 10 minutes walk from CBD but can get free Green Cat bus. Not exactly cheap. The planetarium is good but for some strange reason they refuse to post session times online. You have to phone and ask which can be pretty annoying.
title: For science fans

body: Brilliant ways to teach science to kids. Its recommended to get a yearly pass for scitech for the family. My kids aged 8 and 10 loved being there. Every time they found something new to learn. All the show are high recommended.
title: Excellent learning for kids

body: This place has so much for the kids. The shows are fantastic, I would recommend checking it out. The Planetarium is awesome.
title: Fun day out.

body: Was a fun day out with my 4yr old. Lots of things to learn n discover. Saw a egg hatching, gravity, xray images of ourself, many more. Oh yes n the planet show. Awesome science.
title: Learning adventure

body: After visiting several sciencecentres around Australia I would rate this one as one of the best. Children will have fun here for hours. However the adjoining planetarium has great shows for adults as well. This was my favourite part.
title: Hands on fun for children

body: We had heaps of fun here. Honestly you can spend a few hours here. Planetarium is awesome experience and very well done. Plenty of stuff to learn. Loved the session on starlight. Looks like you watching in 3D with it all around you

body: Scitech is a great interactive place for kids of all ages from 3 to 93. There are permanent exhibits that demonstrate many scientific principles, themed featured exhibits that change every six months or so, live demonstrations, interactive shows for younger kids, a planetarium and a dedicated area for very young children. I have been to Scitech many times over the years, first with my own kids and now with my grandkids. The last time I went in Januray, I took my 5 year old grandson for his first ever visit. He was beside himself with delight. We happily spent 5 hours there and even then I almost had to drag him away. He now says he wants to be a scientist and work at Scitech.
title: Kid's Heaven

body: One of a kind attraction to engage and entertain kids up to about 15 years. Lots of science and culture and history embedded in entertaining activities. Good venue for parent child bonding.
title: Something for Big Kids as Well

body: This place is awesome, some of the stuff is a little outdated but for the most part it is brilliant. My kids spend hours here playing with the different equipment and learning new things.
title: Great place for kids to do some exploring

body: This place has so much for the kids. The shows are fantastic, I would recommend checking it out. The Planetarium is awesome.
title: Fun day out.

body: Was a fun day out with my 4yr old. Lots of things to learn n discover. Saw a egg hatching, gravity, xray images of ourself, many more. Oh yes n the planet show. Awesome science.
title: Learning adventure

body: After visiting several sciencecentres around Australia I would rate this one as one of the best. Children will have fun here for hours. However the adjoining planetarium has great shows for adults as well. This was my favourite part.

body: As the title suggests, don't go with high expectations, and you will be fine. i have visited several science musuems, but this by far, for a major city, has to be one of the most dissapointing.Its all one ONE floor, and can be all accomplished within 60 minutes, at a slow pace. The planetarium was very disappointing, as the show lasted 45 minutes and was more adult themed then kids orientated. So much so, that half the audience walked out, 20 minutes into the show. Food is expensive that's why the Pack lunch area was completely. Enjoy.

body: Don't come to Scitech expecting anything like the Powerhouse Museum or it's ilk. Museums in Perth tend to be small, slightly tired affairs (a result of poor State government funding to the Dept of Culture and Arts) and Scitech is no different.
title: Popular (and busy) small museum.

body: Very popular (and thus very crowded) on any day that is very hot or wet. This is one of Perth's best indoor attractions and showcases the fun that can be had in science. The planetarium show should not be missed and other live science shows throughout the day will always be good to watch. This is affordable entertainment and if you are in Perth, and have children this is pretty much an essential part of their childhood experience.
title: Great fun

title: great for kids

body: This was our first visit to Scitech. My daughter loved the interactive displays and being able to touch, feel and play with things which challenged her to think about how it all works. We enjoyed the show about things that glow and loved the Planetarium. On the day we visited, we got to experience 2 different 'movies'. The entry price is reasonable and includes free parking for the day with validation or permit, depending on where you park. There is an allocated eating area where there are vending machines or you can byo. There is a cafe opposite the ticket booth also. Great day out!
title: Great day out!

body: A couple of times a year I take a group for teenagers to Scitech and I never get any complaints! They love it here with all of the exciting machines and challenges that are presented. Warning! Try not to fall asleep in the planetarium... It's so calming, dark, warm and comfy in there.

body: The kids had a lot of fun with all the hands-on science fun. A favourite was the construction site and it was interesting to see how kids who had never met before all came together in a spirit of team work to "build" their project. The puppet show was extremely good and really engaged the little kids. The "explosions" show was more for older kids but also quite interesting. I have been to much better Planetariums though! It was mother's day so mom went in free which is always good:-). All in all I would call it an average experience. Everything was good but lacked the 'wow' factor that science can normally so easily bring.
title: Good Family Outing

body: This was our first time visiting Scitech. the kids loved it. There are loads of interactive things for them to do, and try out. We went to the planetarium and saw the Space School show. It was very informative and the kids enjoyed it. I did find myself giving things ago, so it's not just for little kids, but big ones too! The kids want to go back again, which we will.
title: A great day out.

body: We visited Scitech as a spur of the moment decision because the weather was awful! I can say we were not disappointed! We really wish we had arrived earlier since we missed most of the shows and we would have liked to see some. I'm not sure if my hubby or my son had a better time, but it was certainly a fun way to wile away a dreary day (or even a nice day). A rival to Scienceworks in Vic!
title: A great way to spend a rainy afternoon!

body: Good display of scientific topics. Interactive displays for kids and adults. Entertaining for all, and displays change regularly.
title: Good for adults but especially kids

body: This is great for visiting families. Very interactive but you need to pick your time. I took interested elderly friends who could not get a look in with all the kids that push in. Suggest you avoid holidays and ring during term time as you need to avoid school groups too. Go later in the afternoon when the kids tour groups have gone back to school.
title: Don't go in the school holidays

body: Kids 6 and 7 loved it. Both ran off as soon as we got there. We managed to get through most of it in 90 minutes although kids would have happily stayed another hour.
title: Good fun for kids

body: We visited Scitech as a spur of the moment decision because the weather was awful! I can say we were not disappointed! We really wish we had arrived earlier since we missed most of the shows and we would have liked to see some. I'm not sure if my hubby or my son had a better time, but it was certainly a fun way to wile away a dreary day (or even a nice day). A rival to Scienceworks in Vic!
title: A great way to spend a rainy afternoon!

body: Good display of scientific topics. Interactive displays for kids and adults. Entertaining for all, and displays change regularly.
title: Good for adults but especially kids

body: The kids had a lot of fun with all the hands-on science fun. A favourite was the construction site and it was interesting to see how kids who had never met before all came together in a spirit of team work to "build" their project. The puppet show was extremely good and really engaged the little kids. The "explosions" show was more for older kids but also quite interesting. I have been to much better Planetariums though! It was mother's day so mom went in free which is always good:-). All in all I would call it an average experience. Everything was good but lacked the 'wow' factor that science can normally so easily bring.
title: Good Family Outing

body: This was our first time visiting Scitech. the kids loved it. There are loads of interactive things for them to do, and try out. We went to the planetarium and saw the Space School show. It was very informative and the kids enjoyed it. I did find myself giving things ago, so it's not just for little kids, but big ones too! The kids want to go back again, which we will.
title: A great day out.

body: This is great for visiting families. Very interactive but you need to pick your time. I took interested elderly friends who could not get a look in with all the kids that push in. Suggest you avoid holidays and ring during term time as you need to avoid school groups too. Go later in the afternoon when the kids tour groups have gone back to school.
title: Don't go in the school holidays

body: The Perth Scitech is well worth visiting, again, this is a review I meant to write on a few occasions, I really appreciate the effort Scitech go to !. My two children loved our repeated visits ..... terrific overall, very educational indeed for young and old . Very good facilities, good staff .
title: Science ..... Very Educational , worth a visit !

body: Brilliant in every way. If you want your children to be stimulated, challenged mentally and have some fun - all while they are with you - then this is the place to go on a rainy old day. Or even a sunny one too!
title: Kids (and grown-ups) delight!

body: Scitech is an Eduactional Scientific Place and Excelllent for the Whole Family.There is so much to learn and see.I really enjoyed all the different activities and had lots of fun.So many Games to keep Adults and Children entertained.One can learn so much from this Unusual Attraction.I really think every country in the world should have something similar to Scitech.It was reallly worthwhile to see and experience Something Totally different.I would recommend every visitor who goes to Perth to not miiss this great Attraction for anything.I would definitely go there again,very goood value for money.

body: I loved taking my kids here and now that I am a grandparent, I have returned and remember why I liked it so much. The kids can touch, learn and play at their own level. Younger kids can look at the real fish and chickens, go to the puppet show, and play in their area. Older kids and adults can experiment, make things, see how things work and attend science shows or the planetarium. The special areas are always changing. Last time I went it was all about circus attractions, this time it was transport with planes to climb in and feel like flying and airships to manoevre. You can take your own lunch or enjoy the cafe there. It keeps the kids entertained for hours. I bought a years pass which gets unlimited entry and free parking and discounts at the cafe so have been 4 times already. Thoroughly recommended!
title: all day outing for the whole family

body: Great place to visit for a day out in Perth! You'll find something here for everyone in the family from the toddlers to the big kids! Entry prices are reasonable but if you're staying in Perth for a while and wish to visit more than once I would highly recommend the yearly pass (4 visits and it pays for itself). Children under 4 are free as well!

body: It was raining and cold so we headed here! Although very busy everyone had a turn at everything. One highlight was the Science show, that went about 25 minutes. The young man was a laugh and kept the audience captivated whilst sharing cool science experiments. There is so much to touch and see and explore there. If you drive into the city park underneath and show your ticket when you pay admission and they validate your parking, so you don't pay!
title: Great indoor activity

body: Visited Scitech with 2 7 year old girls. They wanted to rush about looking at everything at once whilst I was content to take my time. There are a number of different areas to go to, each with a different theme. This time there was a section about innovation and inventions and another with travel as its topic. These were quite interesting but were aimed at a slightly higher age group, possibly 10 and above would get more out of it than the 7 year olds.
title: Interesting

body: Scitech is a great, interesting and fun day out. Myself and 2 friends went and we are all adults but still had an amazing time.
title: Great way to spend a day...felt like a child again!!

body: A really good way to spend a few hours on the weekend. When there is a special show at the Planetarium, it is worth catching the show and then doing the interactive activities. The staff are excellent.
title: Scitech Fun

body: It was raining and cold so we headed here! Although very busy everyone had a turn at everything. One highlight was the Science show, that went about 25 minutes. The young man was a laugh and kept the audience captivated whilst sharing cool science experiments. There is so much to touch and see and explore there. If you drive into the city park underneath and show your ticket when you pay admission and they validate your parking, so you don't pay!
title: Great indoor activity

body: Highly recommended for kids of all ages. Activities keep kids busy for hours on end. The Planetarium show was very educational and unique. Parking is endorsed to be free and food is available in the cafes. Great range of activities to keep kids amused and interested continuously. Have to keep a good eye on them as they intend to roam from activity to activity as so many are interesting.
title: Little peoples science

body: Visited with my darling wife, even though its centered towards kids, a great place to spend a couple of hours and seriously as adults we indulged our selves and came out learning a lot more facts.

body: Great place to visit for a day out in Perth! You'll find something here for everyone in the family from the toddlers to the big kids! Entry prices are reasonable but if you're staying in Perth for a while and wish to visit more than once I would highly recommend the yearly pass (4 visits and it pays for itself). Children under 4 are free as well!
title: Good family fun

body: I came here recently after not visiting for many years and loved it! There were lots of things to interact with and play with, whilst learning bits of information along the way. I would definitely recommend a visit, although make sure you arrive early so you don't miss the shows.

body: A great place to keep curious kids occupied for hours. Understandably entry is not cheap but reasonably good value if you allow the time to have a good look around. Can get crowded during school holidays; especially during summer when the good air-conditioning is probably a big attraction. Displays and exhibits change so worth checking the website and see what's new. Inside food and drink is basically all out of vending machines so you will save money by bringing your own or eating at the cafe near the entrance. Been to and seen some great kid's birthday parties there too.
title: ALLOW AT LEAST A FEW HOURS TO GET YOUR MONEY'S WORTH

body: My son loves Scitech. Every time he's been the exhibits have been different wich is great because he doesn't get bored from doing the same things. Lots of exciting interactive activities and learning experiences. High tech and great visual displays. Well worth a visit if you have children under the age of 11.
title: Always changing, brilliant kids activities.

body: So much to see and do! The floor display is always fun and interactive and the special displays change regularly. We go back every few months as my son loves it!
title: Something for everyone!

body: One visit to scitech was inspirational!! Make sure you seek out Chris. He has a passion for science that is matched only by his enthusiasm and charm, not to mention his ability to drop knowledge bombs upon request. Make sure you check out the magnets, it will literally change your perspective on what is possible in the world. Scitech is a haven for clever people.....AMAZING!!!!
title: if it can happen, it will. If it can't happen.......it won't!

body: Took my two sons in school holidays, saw the Flight 3D movie which was mind-blowing (and their fave topic), then walked around most exhibits over three hours, til they were exhausted. Very high adrenalin place if you're into science, space, or just life. Scitech has done a superb job, easily competing with the Singapore science centre which we visited this year.

body: We have fond memories of Scitech taking our children there years ago. We had the opportunity to take our nephews there, and were disappointed. Scitech, when we visited, seemed to cater for the younger crowd (4-9 year old). Our youngest was 10 and he found it very boring. Unfortunately they couldn't cater for a wider age grouping
title: Great for young children, otherwise, pretty average

body: We went with our 4 year old grandson, as we were in the area and the weather was not the best. Possibly a bad choice of day, as it was school holiday. If there were only preschool age children , it would have been far easier to access all the exhibits.
title: Went during school holiday, maybe bad choice of day

body: Sci tech is located only about five minutes from the CBD. There is parking outside but if you go during the school holidays or their busier times you can always park at harbour town shopping centre and sci tech is only a five minute walk away.
title: Great fun for both kids and Adults

body: Took my two sons in school holidays, saw the Flight 3D movie which was mind-blowing (and their fave topic), then walked around most exhibits over three hours, til they were exhausted. Very high adrenalin place if you're into science, space, or just life. Scitech has done a superb job, easily competing with the Singapore science centre which we visited this year.
title: This place is brilliant!!

body: The entry fee is reasonable,.cameras are optional.Of-course wear comfortable clothes and shoes.
title: A visit with Lots to Do and See.

body: Scitech is a great day out to spend with your family. Kids can also learn a lot with the number of interactive activities. The planetarium is a must.
title: Fantastic

body: We reach Scitech at 2pm, just in time to catch the last show of the day, inside the Planetarium. The other shows (inside the smaller theatre within) were all over. For this reason, you should reach earlier, perhaps 10am, in order to catch more shows. Plenty of scientific and construction stuff for the kids to play with. Nothing much for the parents to do while the kids have fun. The building have other stores where adults can spend time on. Remember to bring your parking ticket along as the Scitech can validate for you.
title: Lots of interesting things for kids to try out

title: Saturday at Scitech

body: we have been visiting Scitech multiple times a year since the kids were toddlers - they are now 10 and 12 years old. There are multiple fascinating displays for all ages, and a good mix of temporary themed exhibits as well as the permanent ones. puppet shows for the littlest, stage demonstrations and the planetarium provide additional entertainment and information. We usually spend at least half a day here. Can be very crowded in the school holidays.
title: A favourite with the kids

body: If you have young kids, it's a great place to visit. I was there with my kids - 11 and 7 years old. My younger didn't want to leave after 5 hours. We parked the car at City West underground parking and got the ticket validated when we purchased the entrance tickets for free parking for the day. Do bring some snacks as places to eat are limited. In scitech there are some vending machines for drinks and snacks with tables and chairs for you to have your snack.
title: Worth while for a visit

body: Huge place with interactive experiences!!! Electronic, mechanical, water. lasers, mirrors, a 180 movie theater with Morgan Freeman narration about stars. Excellent place to go with kids, teenagers and also adults. Schools can give a joyfull afternoon to students in there!

body: This is a great day out, inexpensive and very informative for both children and adults alike. All very interactive so get involved and have fun. Take your own picnic and eat in the designated area right in the middle of the venue. The planetarium is situated in the same building with a NASA space travel event in the morning and a trip around our galaxy in the afternoon and is absolutely brilliant. 5 minutes from the city centre.
title: Fantastic

title: Awesome

The only down side was the lack of places to eat, we had to walk over to a neighbouring shopping precinct for food as the one small cafe that was open, had 1 member of staff, struggling to deal with everyone wanting food. Staff were all amazing and friendly, quite knowledgeable also.
title: Great place!!!

body: a lot of work and effort has been put into keeping kids engaged in the activities the staff are very friendly and really care about the place. the news space exibition was on when i visited with my family and it was fab!!
title: great day out with the kids

body: Absolutely worth going here...Loved it..Such a relaxed atmosphere...So many things to do, read and participate in...They really have got this business running superb...The best science centre ive ever attended. Hands down beats Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney science centres...The entry price is sooooooo worth it...
title: Awesome

body: A few minutes off the Perth City proper. Sits strategically on a carpark, the City West is also home to a furniture and appliance store outlet. My Son and Daughter came home disappointed, probably more disappointed than i was. If you hit this place in the early afternoon, the main attraction could be either or as times of events are simultanous and far apart that you couldnt catch both on the same afternoon. More than due for an upgrade in attractions as lots and heaps are happening in space. Operators of the scitech should be treated to Orlando, Florida for some Kennedy space center adventure and they wont probably come home to Perths Scitech.
title: Not worth the price and time

body: Well worth visiting, our 6 and 8 year olds loved it. $52 for a family ticket, lots of interactive/ educational things to see and do and the planetarium show (45 minutes) was excellent.
title: First class fun and learning

body: This place is not only educational but a fun day out for those of all ages! It combines learning with interactions and fun games for all to try.

body: I have been here a few times and my little 5 year old girl loves it. It is very hands on in regard to playing with things and building stuff. The are shows to see and food and drink to purchase. There is lots of things to see and do and you could easily spend a whole afternoon here. Very educational and well run. Parking is free if you display your free pass obtained when you buy your ticket.
title: Really good for Everyone of all ages

title: First class fun and learning

body: So Good. great for all ages, even the adults. When we went they had the extra bit on Astronauts and what it takes to become one and what they go thru etc. The Planetarium which is included in the ticket was on Planets and they also had another show on Flying. The only down side I found was that there was no real caf inside, it was all vending machines and every thing was $2.50. You could bring your own food and drinks in but we didn't know that. There are 2 places to eat out side and you can come and go all day. So you could leave for lunch and come back in. There was also a Lecture on Maths and how it is related to science and every day. Lots of explosions. It really is good value for money if you want to spend the whole day there. It was busy but shows every half an hour took a crowd away for 30mins. You can buy tickets on line or there. There is parking there but only 2 hours free. You then have to pay. If you go early there is plenty of undercover parking. You could get there by bus or a walk from the train station.
title: So totally worth it.

body: Great way to spend a morning. While we were a group of adults only, we found plenty to do. The 3-D movie was awesome and the space display engaging and thoughtfully done. We skipped many of the hands-on activities designed for young children, but found plenty to challenge us in other areas.
title: Great for Families AND Adults!

body: Governments want to get students "interested in science" and Scitech is one way of encouraging this interest. Scitech has good exhibits and has interactive displays which interest young people. Adults are usually visit Scitech as "add ons" for their children. I find it interesting, and I'm not really interest in science. If you go to Scitech you may be just tagging along as company for your children.
title: Get interested in science

body: Came here thinking it might be like the Science Museum in London. How wrong was I.
title: Ok for kids

body: There is something here for all age groups. Very educational and lots of exhibits to get hands on with and be challenged. Children of all ages love the variety and the hands on aspect of Scitech. The adults can find plenty here to amuse themselves as well. I have been here a number of times and have always had lots of fun.
title: Fun for the whole family.

body: Hands on experience for kids of all ages. Changing displays as well as constants. Makes science fun.
title: Scitech

body: I went with my ten y.o. son he wasn't relating to much... I think he is just a little too old. He did enjoy the show "Extreme Weathers".
title: Definitely for younger kids...

body: A good place to keep kids amused for an afternoon. Very interactive and informative, lots for kids to do. Love the robot!
title: One for the kids

body: Governments want to get students "interested in science" and Scitech is one way of encouraging this interest. Scitech has good exhibits and has interactive displays which interest young people. Adults are usually visit Scitech as "add ons" for their children. I find it interesting, and I'm not really interest in science. If you go to Scitech you may be just tagging along as company for your children.
title: Get interested in science

body: There is so much to do at this museum. It is a fantastic learning environment for children. Some parts are a little dated (the 3-7yr old area) but lots of the displays are fairly new. There is a baby change area/parents room and a picnic area. There isn't a cafe but they do allow you to exit and return. The cafe in the shopping centre was closed the day we went so we had to venture a little further. We had a great few hours spent at the museum.
title: Great for children.

body: Lots of hands-on exhibits to keep children engaged. The place is actually half the size of the Singapore Science Centre but holds as much fun. The presentations by the staff in the planetarium are very interesting and fun. Catching the different shows at different timings helped us pass 5 hours easily. The caf downstairs serves simple food, not the most yummy but enough to fill us up. SciTech is 10mins walk from Watertown Outlet Mall where there are more food outlets but do look out for traffic as there is a busy intersection.
title: Hands-on fun for the family

body: Always loved scitech as a kid, even now as an adult I still love it. Defiantly a place to visit and enjoy spending time with the family. It is also very educational as well as fun which is a bonus.
title: Great for the family

title: Scitech

body: I have visited Scitech on and off since the 80s and learned a couple of things along the way... Staff are motivated and enthusiastic, exhibits are ever-changing with some good staples, and shows are always engaging. The place caters well for various age groups and would also be fun for adults-only groups during a quiet time (I actually went to a 40th birthday there one evening). School groups can turn the place into a nightmare so pick your times to visit carefully (very early or late in the day is usually good). Saying that, school excursions are run well, with great activities planned for specific age groups. If you visit as a one-off, allow plenty of time to watch the science shows and visit the Planetarium, particularly if you have children above 8 years of age. Though small, Scitech compares quite well to other Science centres around the world. If you live in Perth, purchasing the yearly pass for the family can be great as you can pop in whenever you are near the city and just stay for short bursts (which is probably more beneficial from an educational perspective).If you park in the car park below, Scitech will cover the cost of your parking - just take your ticket to the desk and show them.
title: Pick your time to visit!

body: I really dislike these sort of pseudo educational demo dumb places where your kids get to turn loads of knobs on broken machines. That said this was a particularly impressive one. Not sure how much they actually learn flitting from installation to installation. What is the point of distorting mirrors for example. It's a human zoo and well worth staying away from if you are an adult. The kids enjoyed it though so that's the main thing.
title: I hate these sort of "educational" places

Ticket to the Scitech include entrance to Planetarium too and you can see 2 interesting films. You can go there by car, bus or train. Find entrance to the Scitech si quite tricky because its hidden inside of shopping centre. :-)
title: Its not just for children

body: Great fun for the family. There are many interesting display and exhibitions. Place is a little tired and run down however I believe they are moving eventually.
title: Good family fun

body: Took two boys (10 & 11) in the April school holidays. Lots of people but lots of activities available. They, and I, enjoyed making helicopters and spinning saucers, dodgem balls, co-operating as a space team, learning about gravity, heat transference, levitation, angles, hearing tests, astronomy, and much more. A very full day. I recommend taking your own snacks/lunch.
title: Young scientists at play!

body: kids bored holidays too long...Scitech always winds back the pressure one of our standbys when the kids are ratty!!!!!!!
title: kids great experience

body: Went to Scitech with 6yo daughter and enjoyed it probably more than she did. Been a while since we had gone there but a lot of the exhibitions were the same.
title: Interesting but needs ipdate

body: This place is suitable for family with young children. Its fun for the younger ones and adults. There are more activities for children to take part and enjoy.
title: Suited for Family with Young Children

body: As a kid, we visited Scitech numerous times, so I was excited to go back after 15 years. Many of the activities have been around for years, but there is alot of new things to do. There's a section for younger children as well. The Planetarium is great for kids and adults.
title: Great day out for the kids

body: My son truly enjoyed the experience and learned a lot of science. We have booked for the next one and he is looking forward to it.

title: Its not just for children

body: A trip to SciTech and I thought oh well the grand-kids will love it, but guess what WE LOVED IT TOO!! A really great day out and it just went on and on and on with greatness. Then when you thought that it couldn't get any better the staff just blew us away with their great customer service - robots on the floor, paper helicopter races, fun mirrors and much much more and all dished up with heaps of patience and lots of fun......
title: For the Big Kids Too!!

body: Great day out for the kids. Loads and loads for them to do. They have fun playing with things but learn about science at the same time. The shows are education and very interesting.

body: perfect place for the kids to let off steam and learn about all kinds of stuff. Adults learn a bit as well. The activities change regularly so even if you visited 3 or 4 times a year it would never be the same. A great way for the kids to learn through interactive play and activities. a must do if you have primary school kids
title: sci tech headache relief

body: Been here with my two teenagers on a weekday. Lots of small school children that they felt out of place. But after awhile, they pretty much enjoyed tinkering around. Very engaging and interesting how science works. Watch the Math plus explosion at the Science Theater and it was fun and great. You'll learn a lot! Next was the Planetarium. But dragging as its a bit more than a hour but interesting just the same. Nice and amazing theater.

body: We visited here last week with our 15 year old on a trip from Sydney. At first I thought it was all going to be 'too young' for our son but we were wrong. Admission prices are very reasonable and, for me, the trip into the Planetarium was worth the price of admission alone.

body: I have visited Scitech many times over the years, from primary school to university, and each time I have enjoyed all of the displays. They are informative, interactive and most importantly enjoyable. I now enjoy taking my younger siblings and watching them enjoy the wonders of science.

body: Scitech is aimed at getting kids interested in science. It does that well, there are plenty of things to keep kids interested for a few hours. Scitech is in West Perth, not far from the City.

body: We were taken there in the school holidays with our 4 grandchildren (9 to 16 yrs). The visit was explosive, spent about 4 hours there and we had as much fun as the children. Good coffee shop just outside in City West Centre but there is self service inside ( once out you cannot get back in without paying again) Recommended as a family day out but expect a cost of between $80 to $100.

body: There is a bunch of these places popping up around the country. Questicon in Canberra is one of them. We spent only 2 hours here though easily could have spent 5 & wish we had. If/when we return to Perth will go here again.
title: Fully recommend

body: Great place to visit in a rainy day with kids of all ages, even the adults will be kept busy. Money well spent! Easy access by train or car, parking nearby.
title: Lots of activities

body: Great place for kids and adults for all ages who is keen to learn something new in an interactive way of science. I went to see 'We are Aliens!' show in the Planetarium. It was stunning and spectacular. I felt like I'm in a different dimension. Highly recommended!
title: Planetarium rules!

body: We were taken there in the school holidays with our 4 grandchildren (9 to 16 yrs). The visit was explosive, spent about 4 hours there and we had as much fun as the children. Good coffee shop just outside in City West Centre but there is self service inside ( once out you cannot get back in without paying again) Recommended as a family day out but expect a cost of between $80 to $100.
title: Planetarium

body: Well, we have visited on few occasions and my view has not changed. It is good fun for the kids, no doubt about that, but as it's enclosed there is heaps of noise so you get sick of it pretty soon.
title: Very noisy

body: Excellent hands on science experiments for kids and adults. The attached planetarium program was also excellent, and programs ran hourly. We spent and hour on the science experiments and 45 minutes on the planetarium program. The noise level tends to be high because the kids are excited about the experiments, and the younger kids are successful with some of the experiments.
title: Great Hands on Science Experiments

title: Very noisy

body: A pretty good place for a rainy day in Perth (not many of those!). Many things for kids to try and interact with, but in my opinion the Scitech main area leans too much towards play than learning or demonstrating any serious scientific principles. The Planetarium though is superb, some great shows and the narrators are great communicators. Still, I think it would be hard to find enough to do for longer than 2 hours. The entrance ticket is too expensive at $19 per adult - feels more like a $10-$12 attraction to me.
title: Strictly for kids

body: Always a favorite for locals & tourists alike, this interactive science center will have you & your kids amused for hours. Don't be put off by the entrance price as you consider that this is easily 3_4 hours of interactive fun. There are also free science shows & all in all its a great fun education for both adults & kids. Free undercover parking is also a great bonus & a 3 minute drive from Watertown for some great retail therapy when you're done.
title: Great for kids

body: What a fantastic place. Coming from Canberra with our young son (2yr old) we thought we would use our Questacon membership to access SciTech. We could not have had a better time. Great hands on displays for all ages, and surprisingly quiet for a Saturday. Definitely recommend for anyone travelling to Perth with children on any age.
title: Brilliant

title: Trying to reach a younger crowd

body: This museum is amazing for the whole family! Lots of great shows for everyone - Puppet show for the young ones, light show which is very interactive with the audience, Planetarium which was showing Dark Universe is very good and shows lots of information about the outer space and creation of the universe. Lots of friendly guides who are willing to help you with anything. There are also HEAPS of interactive experiments and interesting science that you never think of. Great hands on things. Lots of children come here so try come when there are less people otherwise it is very noisy and you don't get much time at the experiments. School holidays are not too bad as the museum seems to empty out around 4:00.
title: Informative yet fun!

body: It is good but not great, compare to Science World in Vancouver or somewhere like Epcot in Florida and you would be dissapointed. A lot of the thjngs are run down, missing bits or broken - lots of kids and not really enough to do - no massive play space or wow factor. The puppet show was a highlight and the guy doing was so brilliant / he was awesome. Cost wise is ok and easy to get to on train - all in all a good experience just needs some funds spent on and the need to regularly test each item of equipment.
title: Pretty good, lacks the wow of similar set ups worldwide

body: This place is really cool and an ideal day out for small and big kids! There's loads to do and it's also educational, plus the themes change regularly so it keeps things interesting.
title: Lots of fun

body: You can lose yourself in Scitech ... there are lots of interactive things to see and do. Its great for young kids and inquiring minds of all ages

body: My three kids, 12, 10, & 8, all loved this place. If you're into astronomy and the universe then I highly recommend checking out the planetarium's capturing the cosmos feature. This was by far one of the most remarkable shows I've ever seen. The 360 degree screen really makes it feel like you're "out there." Plenty of other hands on features for the kiddos make this a great family trip!

body: The children could've spent all day here exploring scientific concepts.The things they enjoyed the most were controlling robots, making flying spinners and movie in the Planetarium , but there are so many activities and things to try that we ran out of time in the 2 hours that we had. It was an excellent educational outing and next time we will allow more time. Don't pay for the car park to start with, if you get your ticket stamped and take it back out to your car, the first couple of hours are free.
title: Hands on Fun!

body: The children could've spent all day here exploring scientific concepts.The things they enjoyed the most were controlling robots, making flying spinners and movie in the Planetarium , but there are so many activities and things to try that we ran out of time in the 2 hours that we had. It was an excellent educational outing and next time we will allow more time. Don't pay for the car park to start with, if you get your ticket stamped and take it back out to your car, the first couple of hours are free.
title: Hands on Fun!

body: My three kids, 12, 10, & 8, all loved this place. If you're into astronomy and the universe then I highly recommend checking out the planetarium's capturing the cosmos feature. This was by far one of the most remarkable shows I've ever seen. The 360 degree screen really makes it feel like you're "out there." Plenty of other hands on features for the kiddos make this a great family trip!
title: Great place to take the kids!

body: We had the mobile Scitech come to our daycare centre. It was just two girls that put on the show and they were good and the children loved it, well done
title: Awesome

body: We visited with kids aged from 1 to 12 and everyone had a great time. There are activities for all ages. As well as the hands on activities there's a planetarium, science theatre and puppet show-for smaller kids. There's also an area just for 3-7 year olds. There are vending machines to buy snacks and food in scitech and we saw 2 cafes outside. But there is a 'eating' area in scitech so we packed our lunch. You could easily spend half a day with older kids. Staff are super friendly and helpful at explaining exhibits. Only negative is that some of the exhibits could do with some extra information about how to use them. If you're driving ask staff to validate your parking ticket for 8 hours free parking. And if you're planning on visiting throughout the year its worth getting a yearly membership.
title: Fantastic place to visit with kids

body: A wonderful place to take the kids, very educational but most of all fun. My boys love going there and playing with all the various exhibits. Would be nice if they were changed more often and we would go there every other week, but sadly they only change exhibits a few times a year. Still an excellent place to go as theres so much to look at and learn.
title: Awesome fun for all!

title: Fun for the brain

body: It was the place to go many years ago, but its getting old and dated now. They just can't keep up without the funding and that is a shame. I think more needs to be invested into this icon of WA. It was the first Tech-type-park/building in Australia, but just has not kept up with the times. Pity, I still really like it.
