body: I have been to scitech multiple times like i am sure many other perth and surrounds inhabitants have been, and every time it gets a lot duller. even the first time no one in my friend group actually enjoyed the experience and the high price for food. There is one exception that will never get old; the planetarium. the planetarium is very cool for all ages. overall, scitech has potential but they are not taking that opportunity.
title: Needs to be updated

body: My children enjoyed the place very much and the exhibits were very interesting and interactive. There were also interesting activities and shows at various timings for the children. However, it would be good to bring your own lunch as there were no caf, only vending machines, at the centre. Therefore, we had to get out for lunch and were able to re-enter again after lunch by presenting the tickets at the counter.
title: Very good shows at the Planetarium

body: This is such a good experience for kids. I have been there many times for excursions before. Scitech has really cool exhibitions that teach kids in a fun way. They are always updating their shows so you can go back as many times as you want. I definitely recommend going into the room with the big screen and chairs that shows videos because it is really cool and educational. We watched a solar system video while we were there.

body: can be tricky to find for tourists, plenty of good and interesting interactive things for adults and kids, cafes and public toilets, there is a cost to enter, not cheap but reasonable, make sure you pay for underground parking.
title: always good for the kids

body: I have been to Scitech on several occasions. Every time I go, the displays are different. With all the interactive science displays,this is such an interesting outing, both for children and adults. The daily run information sessions and theatre pieces are professionally produced and provide fantastic entertainment for children of all ages. For me - I can go into the night sky observatory and learn from that script more and more everytime. All staff are fresh and particulary helpful and knowledgeable. A great place to visit. There is a small 'sit down canteen area', to take a break. You can either purchase food or bring your own picnic. Keep your pockets lined a bit, for the exit gift shop, where you can purchase an array of small or large gifts. All unusual and equally stimulating.
title: Engaging for all ages

body: We arrived after three o'clock and there was a reduced entrance fee - only $34 for two adults. We had a great time and there was loads to learn. We had missed the last planetarium show but there was a smaller show on which was good. Main highlights include the mind game where the aim of the game was to calm your mind, the infrared camera (which provided some great photos for social media!) and the beehive. Perfect for kids and adults - highly recommended!
title: An afternoon at Scitech - suitable for kids and adults!

body: can be tricky to find for tourists, plenty of good and interesting interactive things for adults and kids, cafes and public toilets, there is a cost to enter, not cheap but reasonable, make sure you pay for underground parking.
title: always good for the kids

body: I have been to Scitech on several occasions. Every time I go, the displays are different. With all the interactive science displays,this is such an interesting outing, both for children and adults. The daily run information sessions and theatre pieces are professionally produced and provide fantastic entertainment for children of all ages. For me - I can go into the night sky observatory and learn from that script more and more everytime. All staff are fresh and particulary helpful and knowledgeable. A great place to visit. There is a small 'sit down canteen area', to take a break. You can either purchase food or bring your own picnic. Keep your pockets lined a bit, for the exit gift shop, where you can purchase an array of small or large gifts. All unusual and equally stimulating.
title: Engaging for all ages

body: we're a Scitech member and visit this place regularly. Its awesome for both kids and similarly curious parents. Exhibits and displays are changing so each time we go in there's a different theme. Kids love some of the hands on displays.
title: Great place to keep kids occupied

body: 'We've never visited a planetarium before. Scitech has enough kids activities and fun stuff to last the whole day. The planetarium was very interesting to watch. Great for the kids to learn Astronomy.
title: Must Visit

body: A great way to spend a day with the kids having fun and learning about science at the same time. Lots of hands on activities. Family pass was $52. Free parking. Make sure you buy your ticket online to avoid the queue at opening time. Park anywhere in the underground car park and get one of the staff to validate your parking ticket (this will save you $25). Take food and drinks for lunch. There is an eating area but no real food on sale - just confectionery.
title: Fun, Learning Experience for the Kids

body: We booked the Dark Universe show in the Planetarium and while we were waiting took part in the multitude of hands on experiments that started at the very basic right up to bionic limbs and how you interact with them. The Planetarium was a real buzz which was evident by the continual chatter from everyone as the left the theatre and real value for money attraction to see. You could spend most of the day there without much effort at all
title: This is hands on and all ages will love it

body: Hugely entertaining, something for everyone! Hands on all the way and a great way for kids to learn. I personally love the maze and the Saigon tower puzzle. Can be a zoo on school holidays, but with all the energy that kids have, it is a lot of fun to watch them run from one exhibit to another trying everythihg that they can. We visit Perth twice a year to see our daughter and grandkids and always include Scitech on our "to do" list!
title: A great place for kids and adults alike!!

body: Our kids love good science museums and Sci-tech was pretty good. Good enough that we spend most of the day there and they still didn't want to leave. There are shows and activities and a reasonable number of interactive areas. The museum cafe was closed and the closest cafe (run by the same people) had run out of food, so we went to the large DFO nearby and then went back to Sci-tech. There is a bit of a walk from the nearest bus-stop but less than 10 minutes, the entrance is actually in a shopping centre itself which also took us a couple of minutes to figure out.
title: Our attraction highlight in Perth

body: Scitech is a fun place with seasonal exhibitions. My favourite was the 360 degree bicycle. However, the jewel in the Scitech crown is the planetium. A huge doomed screen that takes you on a journey through the solar system. Great for friends and family.

body: We had a great day here and loved the first show we saw (can't remember the name of the guy who presented, but he had dreadlocks). We went on a weekend and it was rather busy, would have loved to have gone back on a week day but our schedule didn't allow it.

body: I came here over the Eater Long Weekend. Crowds were low. The admission price wasn't to bad. We stayed over 5 hours and only had to leave as someone was picking us up, otherwise we would of been longer. I had an 8yr old and a 12yr old. It does help when the crowds are low, otherwise there may be a wait to get on some of the attractions. My kids could just run from attraction to attraction.
title: WELL WORTH IT!

body: My grandchildren visited with their parents. Cost $50 admission for 2 adults 2 children & they said it was fantastic. They were there over 2 hours & could have stayed much longer but ran out of time.Said it was smaller than Canberra's but equally as good & they highly recommended a vist.

We caught the train in which was very easy and convenient as it stops right outside the complex. We went during school holidays so was very crowded. Missed out on the puppet show as there were no seats left so you do need to line up early for the separate shows or u'l miss out.
title: Something for young and old at scitech

title: WELL WORTH IT!

body: One of those places that can't be covered in one day as there's so much to see and do and understand ... and learn! Not just for kids but we adults learnt a lot too! So if you're based in Perth and have young children, my advice is to get an annual pass so you can visit a few times. Trust me, they won't get bored of it.
title: Loaded with fun educational activities!

body: We took our two grandchildren aged 9 and 5 and to be honest was a very disappointed, it was very crowed with children running amuk and parents spending more time on their phones then watching their children. I think my main gripe was that there was no structure to the displays or activities. It just seemed as if the displays and activities were placed in a largish room with no rhyme or reason and there was no staff to explain anything.
title: Overcrowed and no structure.

body: Scitech is mainly for youngsters, so I took a friend who is a TAFE student with me to help me evaluate it. He said it was very interesting, espefcially the 3D pen and the 3D printer. Scitech will entertain children from a young age. Young children will probably not be interested in the Planetarium, which is included in your ticket price, but mid teens and up will find it fascinating. The location is not great if you are traveling by car, but City West station is nearby.
title: Catching new scientists young

body: Have been taking my daughter to Scitech since she was two for the annual ToddlerFest. Have also been for a 'grown up' trip with work. There is plenty of interesting stuff there for all ages. The special events are very good and hours pass by very quickly. There is no food sold inside so either take a packed lunch with you or take the short walk to the food court in Watertown.
title: Great for everyone

body: One of the best places in perth to take children. Full of hands on activities and also provides a theatre with science shows as well as a planetarium. There is a small cafe on site.
title: Scitech in perth

body: We visited on a weekend noon, and the place was busy with many children and their parents/minders. The entire floor is filled with interesting and very interactive exhibits for children to try out, and there are also additional shows like the Puppet Theater (our two kids were enthralled by the performer, and parents could sit behind and catch a break!), and the Planetarium that we unfortunately missed. Still, this museum is an easy way for kids to spend 2-3 hrs at, and we highly recommend it!
title: Fun place for the kids with many interactive exhibits

body: Scitech has a little something for everyone of all ages but I'd definitely recommend to anyone with kids looking for something safe fun and affordable (They will definitely learn a few things with out knowing it as well)
title: Heaps of fun for the kid's

body: It's always interesting in there and changes what's in there depending on what time of year you, it's a def winner for kids
title: Great for kids

body: Attended with year 2 children and teachers. We had a guide for some of the experience which helped group the kids and give them a basic understanding for those who hadn't attended before.
title: School excursion

body: We went with our children. The museum is informative and exciting. The hands on exhibits are fun. The planetarium was excellent. I highly recommend a visit
title: Great musuem for kids

body: Its a must see when going to Perth. This place makes science fun. I loved it and my kid loved it to. We will be going back. Inside there are tables near vending machines. Outside near the entrance there is a great place to eat so there are choices, you can take your own lunch or buy outside. Dont forget to bring some cash...the giftshop is pretty cool too.
title: Fun

body: Brought our 2 year old niece here to burn off some steam and she absolutely loved it! Couldn't get enough of all the exhibits, and the temporary petting zoo was a hit as well.
title: Excellent for Little Explorers!

body: Wow! It was amazing! Went for the scheduled show of maths and explosion and it was mesmerizing! Very helpful and knowledgable staff. Fun atmosphere! Bring your whole families for great outing. This will increase your brain size!
title: Superb!

body: I took my 5 year old grandson there today for a treat. It really is a treat because it costs a lot of money to get in. Still, he loved it and ran excitedly from exhibit to exhibit. He was underwhelmed by the show in the planetarium which was way above him. (Grandad's joke!). We had a great couple of hours but then we made the mistake of going to the puppet show. Seriously??!! It has nothing to do with science or technology and the script is pathetic. I felt sorry for the poor girl entrusted to do the job - we even had to get her from New Zealand! It was 85% boring chatter and almost nothing to do with puppets. The set was also pathetic. It relied solely on a talking tree. The climax was tame and the kids were bored. Surely Perth can do better than this?
title: Is the puppet show for real??

title: Fun

body: Being kids at heart we enjoyed the hands on activities - especially the robot cars but our favourite was the presentation in the Planetarium.
title: not just for kids

body: We thought we would spend a couple of hours here. Five and a half hours later I dragged my 7 and 8yo away! Admission is great value, including a great planetarium and an entertaining science show as well as five huge rooms of hands on science. Admittedly our whole family are science nuts but I think all families would find something to enjoy. The staff were young and enthusiastic and the place is so big it can absorb a lot of people without feeling crowded. Great day out.
title: Getting our geek on!

body: It is possibly an ideal place to take little children or grandchildren, but unfortunately not much for young adults (high school or above). I was hoping for more displays, models, modern science rather than just games. I was in and out of the playground after 30 minutes, unlike my other visits to similar museums in NSW and ACT. Disappointing!

body: sufficient demo and workshops by Scitech. however, the timings are too close and would take up the whole day if you are interested in the hands on exhibits. There are loads of things to do for the kids between the age of 7 to 12 years of age. there is an area to have some snacks and drinks for the adults when the kids are engaged with the exhibits. there is also a very interactive puppet show. Parking was easy and entrance to scitech will subsidise the parking.

body: Located at Sutherland street, west Perth, the Scitech is a specialty museum with plenty of demos but the hands on activities/exercises take time . Open 930 to4 pm ,There is a lot to do for all age groups but especially for kids like puppet and science shows,planetarium,wonderland discovery shop, cafe. Admission is 19 dollars and 12dollars for kids over 4 years.
title: Scitech

body: What a day it was at Scitech! We went during school hollidays so there were a lot of kids to compete with. Enjoyed the planetarium the best especially the shows narrated by Neil deGrasse Tyson. Also loved the Mindball game - it was pretty fun concentrating very hard to calm the brain's alpha and theta waves to levitate the ball.

body: Science, Physics, Games and Planetarium all these you will LOVE. If you have children they will ask you to go there every weekend. One thing I do not like there-there is no a decent cafe nearby, espesially on a weekend. Do no go there if you're hungry.

body: This is a fantastic interactive activity for the entire family, with the only exception being older teens. It is reasonably priced, educational, safe family fun. Parents can get actively involved or relax with a coffee. Can get busy at times, however, it all just seems to work.

body: Fantastic hands-on childrens science centre and planetarium. There are science based activities for all ages that are really well done, and interesting for parents too! The staff are knowledgeable about the physics behind the experiments and are happy to give detailed kid-level explanations  even if that involves theoretical physics. We stayed until closing time, and still didnt see it all!
title: Just brilliant!

body: Really disappointing visit today. Came here about 5 years ago and all ages really enjoyed it from 11-16 year olds and adults so paid a total of almost $120 for 4 young adults and 2 seniors and felt like walking out after 10 minutes. There was a thing with a ball balancing on air - the ball was missing, a puzzle about number sequences and the numbers wouldnt stay on, the whole thing felt as if it was being run down.
title: Big let down

body: Our grandchildren love to go there. It is good to go early, when it is not quite so crowded. The staff are helpful and there is something for most ages. My granddaughter loved landing a spacecraft on a planet, driving a luna buggy, making things and generally finding things out.
title: Great place to take Children to learn some science.

body: We only had a couple of hours to fill in so it was a bit of a speedy trip through Scitech but definitely still worth it. When we visited there were only a handful of other families there so it was easy to get on to each exhibit. The staff were really friendly and pointed out how some of the exhibits worked. it really is a place you could spend hours in and there is something for everyone.
title: Educational and FUN!
